intro: Cantua uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower cowslip, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture, which helps to retain moisture. Cantua uniflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
